description: During the fall 2021 semester, I was a member of a research team working on a project in collaboration with the CERIAS center at Purdue. The project was intitiated with the purpose of strengthening cybersecurity practices in industrial environments. I helped to set up the initial infrastructure, which included installing the HUBzero CMS on a CentOS server and implementing a workflow for data visualization. At the semester end, I chose to discontinue my graduate education and subsequently resigned from the team.

This was my internship for the summer before I began attending graduate school. Over the course of the internship, I helped to transition company's TAP App project (my undergraduate capstone project) from a Xamarin-based Android/iOS application to progressive web application based on Vue.js and an ASP.NET Core Web API, which obtains client data from the main Cheetah database. I also learned the basics of Scrum and met with the manager of software development at least once a week to give updates on my progress.

As an undergraduate teaching assistant I helped the class instructor to teach the material to the students, assisted students who found themselves struggling, and held several office hour sessions throughout the school week. These classes taught a variety of topics, including discrete mathematics, Python programming, Java programming, and the basics of computer networking.
